p: We conducted our pot experiment in the village of Dengshuiling, southeast of Dongguan City (E 113°31′ −114°15′; N 22°39′−23°09′), Guangdong Province, China. The area has a marine subtropical climate, with a mean annual precipitation of 1819.9 mm, mean annual temperature of 23.1°C and mean annual sunshine time of 1873.7 hr. The zonal vegetation is subtropical evergreen broadleaved forest codominated by Dactyloctenium aegyptium, Paederia scandens and Pharbitis nil. Mikania began to invade this area in the early 1990 s and spread extensively in shrublands and old fields.
